summary: Brandy is a strong alcohol made by distilling wine, usually with 35-60% alcohol. It's often enjoyed after dinner and can be aged in wood or coloured with caramel. Famous types include Cognac and Armagnac from France. Brandy can also be made from fruit, like apples or grapes, and is sometimes called "eau de vie" in French, meaning "water of life."
title: Brandy
